wiki.summary: “luther“ is the third track on Kendrick Lamar’s sixth studio album, GNX. It marks the fifth collaboration between him and long-time friend, SZA. The song is built on lush instrumentals and effortlessly fluent lyrical exchanges, putting SZA & Kendrick’s notorious chemistry on full display. In Kendrick’s verses, he raps about envisioning a world where pain and conflict are eradicated, replaced by light and empowerment for his lover, and how she keeps him grounded, level-headed and inspired. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “luther“ is the third track on Kendrick Lamar’s sixth studio album, GNX. It marks the fifth collaboration between him and long-time friend, SZA. The song is built on lush instrumentals and effortlessly fluent lyrical exchanges, putting SZA & Kendrick’s notorious chemistry on full display. In Kendrick’s verses, he raps about envisioning a world where pain and conflict are eradicated, replaced by light and empowerment for his lover, and how she keeps him grounded, level-headed and inspired. SZA’s ethereal voice provides a soulful counterpart, infusing the track with raw vulnerability and a deep yearning for connection and growth with her partner. The chorus unites their voices, grounding the song and conveying the desire to uplift and to help their partner through trials and tribulations. Read more on Last.fm.
